caption_original:
Canadian Solar was founded in 2001 in Guelph, Ontario, and is one of the three biggest solar companies in the world by revenue. There are over 9,700 employees working in 20 countries on six continents, making it a global leader among clean technology companies. 

In June 2017, Export Development Canada (EDC) announced $91 million in financing to Canadian Solar to aid in the construction of the Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Solar Park in Dubai, which when completed, will be the most powerful solar power plant in the world.

In addition to the project being groundbreaking in size, Canadian Solar is using innovative practices to maximize efficiency as well. The park will use tilting panels to track the sun, rather than standard conventional solar power arrays.
caption_cleaned: Canadian Solar was founded in in Guelph, Ontario, and is one of the three biggest solar companies in the world by revenue. There are over ,700 employees working in countries on six continents, making it a global leader among clean technology companies. In June , Ert Development Canada (EDC) announced $91 million in financing to Canadian Solar to aid in the construction of the Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Solar Park in Dubai, which when completed, will be the most powerful solar power plant in the world. In addition to the project being groundbreaking in size, Canadian Solar is using innovative practices to maximize efficiency as well. The park will use tilting panels to track the sun, rather than standard conventional solar power arrays.

caption_original:
Last week was the start of the hunting season in the Quebec Region. On September 23, through a joint operation between Environment and Climate Change Canada‚Äôs Wildlife Enforcement Branch and the Minist√®re des For√™ts, de la Faune et des Parcs du Qu√©bec (French only), hunters suspected of killing migratory birds illegally and violating laws and regulations surrounding the practice of this activity were intercepted. In total, 70 ducks were seized. An investigation is currently underway to lay charges against the hunters involved.

 
Before you go hunting, find out about the migratory bird hunting regulations for your area. Migratory birds are protected under the Migratory Birds Convention Act, 1994, but hunting of certain species, such as ducks and geese, is allowed during specific periods and in specific areas across Canada. 

To learn more about these regulations: http://ow.ly/gGWc30fzU4a

The forests at Ramacieri in Quebec create a large unbroken chain of habitats for wildlife. Many species, including at risk salamanders, depend on this forest ecosystem. Conserving this land will not only support biodiversity, it will also help remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, helping to address climate change.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is partnering with the Nature Conservancy of Canada through the Natural Areas Conservation Program to protect this unique environment. http://ow.ly/wM8G30g13ZX

Conserving this land will not only support biodiversity, it will also help remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, helping to address climate change. Environment and Climate Change Canada is partnering with the Nature Conservancy of Canada through the Natural Areas Conservation Program to protect this unique environment.

2017 Migratory Bird Hunting Permits are available online.

You can order, print and sign your permit from the comfort of your own home, 24-7! 

Permits are also available for purchase at various Canada Post outlets and independent vendors across Canada. 

As part of our ongoing efforts to reduce costs, fewer urban Canada Post outlets and vendors will be offering the printed version of the permit.

Try the online e-permit system instead! 
http://ow.ly/8Tbg30fBMe2
